review: Nice smallish restaurant off the beaten track.  Can sit outside overlooking a river and nice greenery.  Food and service was very good and plentiful and prices very good too.  Went back for dinner.

We ate dinner at the Honeypot whilst staying in Kandy. It is a local authentic family run restaurant. We were served by a very friendly gentleman. We ordered spring rolls, chicken curry & fish curry lots of veg dishes accompanied the meal, plus rice &...naan bread. We did ask for it to be made less spice & everything was delicious ! We sat on the balcony with lovely views of the water. We also saw the fruit bars flying by as they flew from the botanical gardens. Not a sight you see every day. We also had Beers, gins & water. Such good value for  money ! The total bill was less than £20. Owner ordered us a tuk tuk to take us back to our hotel. Thoroughly enjoyable meal & experien naan bread. Price/quality superb! Delicious food. Nice setting, next to a river with palmtrees. According to waiter, every night around 18h00 - 18h30 passing of thousands of bats above the river. They leave the botanical garden in search of fruits in the jungle. Unique experience!

We had a chicken soup(perfect) with simple French fries with shrimps and rolls. All tasted very good. Also the fresh pineapple juice was excellent. 
The staff pointed us out to a chameleon hiding in the palm tree. Superb spot on the side of the river.
